model
Class Dice

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Observable
      model.Dice

public class Dice
extends java.util.Observable

A Dice object consists of a rack of five dice for use in a Yahtzee game. Since a Yahtzee game can only have one set of five dice, this class implements the Singleton design pattern.

Version:
2.0.1 2/2/2012
Author:
Aaron Lamb

Constructor Detail

Dice

private Dice()
Method Detail

getInstance

public static Dice getInstance()
The Dice object implements the Singleton design pattern, and can therefore have only one instance of the class. This method returns the instance.

Returns:
the single instance of the Dice class

roll

public void roll()
Rolls the dice. If any dice are currently "held" they will not be rolled.

Throws:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the dice have been rolled three times already

toggleDie

public void toggleDie(int die)
"Toggles" the current die between held or not held

Parameters:
die - the die to be toggled

isHeld

public boolean isHeld(int die)
Gets whether the current die is held or not

Parameters:
die - the die in question (zero indexed)
Returns:
true if the die is held, otherwise false

getRoll

public int[] getRoll()
Gets the current configuration (the current roll) of the dice

Returns:
the current roll

getNumRolls

public int getNumRolls()
Getter for the number of rolls in the current turn

Returns:
the number of rolls for the current turn

getStatus

public DiceStatus getStatus()
Getter for the current status of the Dice, either READY, ROLLING, or OUT_OF_ROLLS.

Returns:
the current status for the dice

reset

public void reset()
Resets the dice for the next turn
